view1.subtitle: A visualisation of the CO₂ emissions of the global economy

view2.header: See how much CO₂ is emitted
view2.text: We color areas around the world by their Carbon Intensity. The greener the color, the lesser the footprint.

view3.text: Explore the footprint of a country per capita, GDP generated, or energy consumed. Click on the toggle to switch mode.

view4.text: Emissions related to goods manufactured abroad are taken into account, and appear as part of a country's footprint

country-panel.noDataAtTimestamp: Data is temporarily unavailable for the selected time

footer.foundbugs: Found bugs or have ideas? Report them

tooltips.cpinfo: footprint takes imports into account, territorial ignores them

misc.maintitle: A visualisation of the CO2 emissions of the global economy
misc.oops: Oops! We are having trouble reaching the server. We will try again in a few seconds.
misc.newversion: A new version is available! Press here to reload.
misc.webgl-not-supported: The map can't be rendered because this browser does not support WebGL.

electricityComesFrom: %1$s %% of energy %2$s in %3$s comes from %4$s
emissionsComeFrom: %1$s %% of emissions from energy %2$s in %3$s come from %4$s
electricityStoredUsing: %1$s %% of energy %2$s in %3$s is stored using %4$s
emissionsStoredUsing: %1$s %% of emissions from energy %2$s in %3$s are stored using %4$s
electricityExportedTo: %1$s %% of energy %2$s in %3$s is exported to %4$s
emissionsExportedTo: %1$s %% of emissions from energy %2$s in %3$s are exported to %4$s
electricityImportedFrom: %1$s %% of energy %2$s in %3$s is imported from %4$s
emissionsImportedFrom: %1$s %% of emissions from energy %2$s in %3$s are imported from %4$s

aboutUs.whoAreYou-answer: The Electricity Map is developed and maintained by Tomorrow, a small Danish/French start-up company. Our goal is to help humanity reach a sustainable state of existence by quantifying, and making widely accessible, the climate impact of the daily choices we make.
aboutUs.feedback-question: Can I give you some feedback?
aboutUs.feedback-answer: Please do! Please fill out our feedback form or send us an email!
aboutUs.contribute-question: Can I contribute to your project?
aboutUs.contribute-answer: Yes! The Electricity Map is an open-source project, made possible by our volunteer contributors. If you want to help develop the map, either by adding data sources for new areas, adding new features or fixing bugs, feel free to join us in our github.
aboutUs.workTogether-answer: We are actively looking for new opportunities to collaborate. Send us an email!
aboutUs.disclaimer-answer:
Tomorrow publishes data and images on the electricityMap for information purposes. It makes no claims of correctness nor provides any form of warranties, and reserves the right to change the content at any time or to remove parts without having to inform you of this. Tomorrow assumes no responsibility for, and shall not be liable for, any damages or expenses you may incur as a result of any inaccuracy, incompleteness, untimeliness or obsolescence of the electricityMap, or the information derived from them. It is not allowed to include this webpage, or any of its individual elements, in another webpage, without formal prior written consent.

All intellectual property rights belong to the rightful owners and its licensors. Copying, distribution and any other use of these materials, in particular the energy data, is not permitted without the written permission of Tomorrow, except and only to the extent otherwise provided in regulations of mandatory law (such as the right to quote), unless specified otherwise for specific materials.

This disclaimer may be updated from time to time.
